snippet: By adding the bat and veteran presence of outfielder Michael Cuddyer to their lineup, the Mets made a move in free agency that signaled they plan to contend.
abstract: New York Mets give up their first-round draft pick in 2015 to sign outfielder Michael Cuddyer, free agent most recently with Colorado Rockies, to a two-year, $21 million contract.
lead_paragraph: By adding the bat and veteran presence of outfielder Michael Cuddyer to their lineup, the Mets made a move in free agency that signaled they plan to contend.

headline.main: Mets Make Statement, Signing Rockies’ Cuddyer
headline.print_headline: Mets Make Statement, Signing Rockies’ Cuddyer
